title: UK needs to see EU shift in Brexit talks - minister
text:
Britain's Secretary of State for Education Gavin Williamson is seen outside Downing Street in London, Britain, October 8, 2019. REUTERS/Henry Nicholls

LONDON (Reuters) - Britain needs to see the European Union compromise on Brexit and Prime Minister Boris Johnson is prepared to walk away from negotiations, education minister Gavin Williamson said on Friday amid hope that a deal can be struck by the Oct. 31 deadline.

“We need to see the European Union shift,” he told ITV.

“There is not a sense that we will... refuse to walk away from the table.”
description: Britain needs to see the European Union compromise on Brexit and Prime Minister Boris Johnson is prepared to walk away from negotiations, education minister Gavin Williamson said on Friday amid hope that a deal can be struck by the Oct. 31 deadline.
